feed.title: Review: F.3.A.R.
feed.subtitle: "F.3.A.R." is the third installment of the popular first-person/horror shooter, which focuses on scares and gore to keep gamers on the edge of their seats.

link.title: "F.3.A.R." is the third installment of the popular first-person/horror shooter, which focuses on scares and gore to keep gamers on the edge of their seats.

content.div:
Platforms: X360, PS3, PC

The Deal: F.E.A.R. isn't just an emotion brought on by scary movies about ax-wielding maniacs. It also works as an acronym for the First Encounter Assault Recon, a team of highly trained soldiers that seeks out and destroys paranormal threats. At this point in time, there are no greater threats than Alma Wade and Paxton Fettel, who both use their warped psychic abilities to bend reality and destroy the minds of those who stand in their way. Now as Point Man, the leader of F.E.A.R., you must take up your rifle and hunt down Alma and Paxton before they can, quite literally, scare you to death.

"F.3.A.R." is the third installment of the popular first-person/horror shooter, which focuses on scares and gore to keep gamers on the edge of their seats. If you were looking for just another shooter, you could probably go anywhere, but what sets the F.E.A.R. franchise apart is its keen ability to frighten just about anyone. This is seen even more in this latest edition, as the spooky moments go random as well as scripted, thanks to the all-new Generative Scare System. Now you'll never know when that next frightening moment will come, making it all the more horrifying.
